plot: Confusion arises when Basil tries to catch a girl in a playboy's room after hours, all the while unnerved by a psychiatrist's presence.

When two doctors register for rooms at Fawlty Towers, Basil is delighted. Soon thereafter, Basil discovers that one is a psychiatrist. Basil is terrified of what the psychiatrist might think of him. The doctor has no interest in analyzing Basil; he merely wants to enjoy his stay at the hotel. Meanwhile, a handsome young playboy has checked into one of the "single" rooms, and Basil is determined to prove that the man has a lady visitor. Another visitor to the hotel is an attractive young single woman. Basil manages to make a fool of himself while trying to avoid what he believes to be the psychiatrist's scrutiny.—Ken Miller <wkmiller704@yahoo.com>

Basil takes a severe dislike to a handsome guest that Sybil has obviously taken a liking to. Basil goes out of his way to be rude to the man and when he thinks he has a young woman in his room, goes out of his way to nab him in the act. When an attractive young woman checks in however, Sybil is convinced that Basil is on the prowl and not only slaps him across the face but shuts him out of their room. All this with two doctors staying at the hotel, one of whom is a psychiatrist.—garykmcd
